ROBERT F. SCHENKKAM
DIRECTOR
July 4, 1964
Mr* James Fellows
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
1546 Connecticut Avenue
Washington, D* C*
Dear Jim:
No...I am not Neptune^s daughter...rising up from the
watery depths of the Marianas Trench. (And what would she
be doing down there, anyway, I*d like to knowl) This is,
in truth, merely ol* Chub... eddying up through the mists
induced by the humidity of Austin dog days...hair hanging
in damp tendrils...glasses streaming (or steaming)...brow
glistening. Beautiful! And so reminiscent of Dorian Gray.
(Or is it Dorien Gray? Or Dorien Grey? Or Dorian Grey?)
You seem to be gone from my life, except as a name
which slips here and there from the lips of friends. I
assume you’re getting your share of ’’The Long Snow” of
scripts, memos, comments, carbon copies, family letters,
etc. which swirl and shift about the Utilization Project.
I am coming to think of scripts and their ensuing amended
forms in rather Biblical terms...as wise and foolish versions.
(Except that, of course, the order is reversed.)
I’ve been very happy about the comments on the first two
scripts.. .w^h the ones I’ve seen or heard at least. There
may be thos^who are off muttering down drain pipes to relieve
their psyches. And I got the helpless honks over Lew Rhodes’s
statement to Clair that some of these children talked as if
Marye Benjamin were their teacher,..or, even more probably,
their mother.
In No, 3 I’ve tried to take into account all the suggestions
which you and Clair made, as reflected in his letter of June 5.
In the reference to the scientific method, I neglected in the
rewriting to clarify that, but have written Earl a memo to insert
the word ’’reflecting” before”the scientific method.” Believe
that will do it, ’’The scientific method” is hamm.ered so at
teachers who have anything to do with science, and in turn is
hammered so at their pupils, not only by books on educational
and teaching techniques but by the textbooks themselves (the
ones I’ve seen),..that I believe they won’t have any difficulty
with this reference.
